alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 24 at 5:48PM EST until January 26 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Youghiogheny River At Connellsville affecting Fayette County. .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Youghiogheny River at Connellsville. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding begins in the vicinity of Yough Park. At 14.0 feet, Several inches of water floods basements of about 30 homes along left bank. River is bankful along the left bank just downstream from the Crawford Street Bridge. Water reaches the level of the Hurricane Ivan flood of September 18, 2004. At 14.1 feet, Water reaches level of March 3, 2015. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 3.3 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz.
